title: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
body:
CBC Overview

Measures RBC, WBC, hemoglobin, hematocrit, and platelets. Important for detecting anemia, infection, and hematologic disorders.

title: Red Blood Cell Morphology
body:
RBC Morphology

Examining RBCs helps diagnose anemias:

  • Microcytic – iron deficiency
  • Macrocytic – B12/folate deficiency
  • Normocytic – hemolysis or acute blood loss

title: White Blood Cell Differentiation
body:
WBC Differential

Determines proportion of neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes, eosinophils, and basophils. Changes indicate infection, inflammation, or hematologic malignancy.
